text:
“I know we’re heading in together, but I want to say goodbye here. So, give me your hand!” 

“What’s up with you, Rodya?” 

“Nothing… let’s go… you’ll see.” 

As they climbed the stairs, Razumihin thought maybe Zossimov was right after all. “Great, I’ve messed him up with my talking!” he muttered to himself. 

When they got to the door, they heard voices inside. 

“What’s going on?” Razumihin shouted. Raskolnikov opened the door wide, frozen in shock. 

His mom and sister were on his sofa, waiting for him for an hour and a half. Why hadn’t he thought of them? He knew they were on their way today! They had been grilling Nastasya with questions. She had filled them in on everything. They were freaking out about him “running away” while sick and, from what they heard, delirious! “What on earth happened to him?” They had both been crying and worried sick for that hour and a half. 

When Raskolnikov walked in, they shouted with joy. Both rushed to him. But he stood there like a statue; a wave of overwhelming emotion hit him like a lightning bolt. He couldn’t even lift his arms to hug them.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is taken aback by the unexpected arrival of his mother and sister, who are filled with concern for his well-being.
